alert.note: Alert for Bath; Estill; Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:02PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Powell, Montgomery, southwestern Bath and northwestern Estill Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 201 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Ewington to near Winston. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mount Sterling, Camargo, Ewington, Gatewoods Station, Prewitt and Klondike around 205 PM EDT. Coons Station around 210 PM EDT. Stepstone, Howards Mill, Upper Spencer, Lower Spencer and Oggs Station around 215 PM EDT. Jeffersonville, Peeled Oak, Wiseman Crossing Station, Hargett and Walkers Crossing around 220 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Owingsville, Calloway Crossing, Crooks, Kendall Springs, Weedon, West Irvine, Wisemantown, Hope, Kimbrell, Spout Springs, Irvine, Ravenna, Preston, North Irvine, Bourbon Furnace, Cow Creek, Willow Tree, Hardwick, South Irvine and Cottage Furnace. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Bert T. Combs Mountain Parkway between mile markers 12 and 23. Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 105 and 125. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
